docs.lead_paragraph: Linda Gibbs, New York City’s deputy mayor for health and human services, discusses testing government programs for success or failure.
docs.snippet: Linda Gibbs, New York City’s deputy mayor for health and human services, discusses testing government programs for success or failure.

docs.abstract: Nicholas D Kristof Op-Ed column notes that scientists are increasingly critical of the government's failure to regulate the proliferation of environmental chemicals like bisphenol-A known as endocrine distupters, which can trigger hormonal changes in the body that may not show up for decades.
docs.lead_paragraph: Scientists warn that chemicals we’re exposed to every day can cause genital deformities and even breast cancer. Is our government paying attention?
docs.snippet: Scientists warn that chemicals we’re exposed to every day can cause genital deformities and even breast cancer. Is our government paying attention?

docs.abstract: Editorial argues that competing plans by Congressional Republicans and Democrats to temporarily extend student loan subsidies both fail to address long-term problems facing many college graduates.
docs.lead_paragraph: By proposing quick-fix methods to pay for only a year’s worth of loan subsidies, Congress is not being serious about helping students afford college.
docs.snippet: By proposing quick-fix methods to pay for only a year’s worth of loan subsidies, Congress is not being serious about helping students afford college.

headline.seo: Fighting Illness and Germs on the Road
headline.print_headline: Your Road Buddies: Zillions of Germs
headline.main: Your Road Buddies: Zillions of Germs

docs.abstract: Business travelers can avoid becoming sick from frequent trips if they follow some proactive tips to protect against germs; those who do get sick can mitigate the damage to themselves and their travels with proper planning.
docs.lead_paragraph: If you are proactive against germs and plan for emergencies, you can protect your health when you travel.
docs.snippet: If you are proactive against germs and plan for emergencies, you can protect your health when you travel.

headline.seo: U.S. Lags in Global Measure of Premature Births
headline.print_headline: U.S. Fares Badly In Early Births In Global Study
headline.main: U.S. Lags in Global Measure of Premature Births

docs.abstract: World Health Organization and other agencies, in first country-by-country comparison of premature births, say although American hospitals excel at saving premature infants, the United States is similar to developing countries in the percentage of mothers who give birth before their due date; US does worse on this score than any Western European country and considerably worse than Japan or the Scandinavian countries.
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States is similar to developing countries in the percentage of mothers who give birth before their child is due, according to the World Health Organization and other agencies.
docs.snippet: The United States is similar to developing countries in the percentage of mothers who give birth before their child is due, according to the World Health Organization and other agencies.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Testing, correcting and retesting through rigorous research methods in government programs are so rare, as noted in David Brooks's April 27 column, ''Is Our Adults Learning?,'' that we often perpetuate costly programs that don't work.
docs.snippet: Linda Gibbs, New York City’s deputy mayor for health and human services, discusses testing government programs for success or failure.

headline.seo: Campaign Promotes Healthy Eating Habits in Children
headline.print_headline: An Anti-Obesity Campaign Takes to the Airwaves
headline.main: An Anti-Obesity Campaign Takes to the Airwaves

docs.abstract: Jane L Levere Advertising column; Advertising Council joins forces with Clear Channel Media and Entertainment to run a new series of radio ads about childhood obesity.
docs.lead_paragraph: A series of radio ads about childhood obesity will run in all 150 markets Clear Channel radio stations serve, reaching about 237 million listeners each month.
docs.snippet: A series of radio ads about childhood obesity will run in all 150 markets Clear Channel radio stations serve, reaching about 237 million listeners each month.

headline.seo: Wal-Mart’s Good Citizen Efforts Face a Test
headline.print_headline: Wal-Mart’s Good-Citizen Efforts Face a Test
headline.main: Wal-Mart’s Good-Citizen Efforts Face a Test

docs.abstract: Controversy is building over Wal-Mart's role in a Mexican bribery scandal, and the company's desire to stay out of the limelight will now be put to a test; to help weather the fallout, company will rely on the relationships it has worked assiduously to develop in Washington during the last decade--relationships that its critics say have insulated it from political threats.
docs.lead_paragraph: With controversy building over its role in a Mexican bribery scandal, Wal-Mart’s desire to stay out of the limelight grows.
docs.snippet: With controversy building over its role in a Mexican bribery scandal, Wal-Mart’s desire to stay out of the limelight grows.
